review_title: Can I say dam on this platform?
pros:
The understanding of a work/life balance in the today’s busy world is more of a tight rope walk than ever before. This orangization gets that. 

Senior management goes out of its way, truly above and behind, to keep every employee in know about what is going on - completely transparent. The growth model being implemented here is one that provides for a bright future; for the staff and patients. This oranginaztion has found a way to keep its eye closely on the bottom line while being able to provide for it’s employees and still keep its primary focus on the patients while making sure that each patient that comes through the door is treated just like family. Like every other working adult, each and every staff member here wants nothing more than to take care of their fellow community members and neighbors, while being able to provide for their own immediate family. This company not only embraces that concept, but actively engages staff to look for ways to advance that concept.

Being a part of this organizization has not only allowed me to be a part of this community in ways I never imagined, but has also and truly allowed me to advance my career while raising a family.
cons: If you understand the importance of family, work life balance and adancing ones self, you will be hard pressed to find anything negative to say about this organization.

pros: Salaries are decent, benefits are good.
cons: Favoritism is rampant with certain staff members and management; the same rules regarding time, attendance and appearance do not uniformly apply to everyone. Management is top heavy,  most are not duly qualified as managers and are appointed based on clinical titles rather than leadership qualities. Favored employees receive overtime hours with frequency while other newer employees are chastised. "Do as I say, not as I do" mentality seems to rule management decisions.

pros:
The mission of the organization is great- everyone deserves affordable quality healthcare.  The PTO is great- you get sick and PTO time as well as 9 Holidays a year.  They offer competitive rates for insurance and have a 403B  plan.  
The best part of my job is the people I work with- caring and honest.
cons: Sometimes it can be a fast-paced environment and you have to be willing and able to change.  Programs are always being updated for the good of the company- but sometimes it takes a day or two to get used to the new way.

pros: There is great stability here and room for advancement. I took a job here to get my foot in the door and hopefully move up to bigger and better things which exactly what happened. Talent is recognized pretty quickly.
cons: The benefits are kinda pricey when you are on their family plan, although the price did drop dramatically last year. Its still a good chunk of change.

pros: Pay is decent. Vacation time is good. Computer systems are decent and not too slow. Place is relatively clean and the have security guards. Greatly needed!
cons: If you are not related to Linda Muller you have little chance of success. Those who are related or have a "special" relationship with her are untouchable. Even when they impregnate a few co-workers.   Too many to list. Mainly unqualified management without college or ability to make appropriate decisions. Too many people trying to make decisions about things they know nothing about

pros: The company is constantly expanding. There's plenty of opportunities to grow within the organization. They are a company that likes to promote from within.
cons: There's a disconnect between each department, and each building. There's also a lack of communication between upper management and general workers.

job_title: Program Assistant in Mount Holly, NC
pros: Co workers are hard working and work together as a unit, treat each other as family. Great place to work!
cons: At times, management doesn't heed the advice of the line workers.

pros: Ability to learn, grow, and transfer departments. Great place to work and build a foundation of education in health care.
cons: Pay is not equal across the board. There is favoritism and no flexibility with schedule. Severely strict 9-5 schedule.

pros: It's a great place to work and has reasonable people and I love the atmosphere
